page.title: 19PUBLIC QUESTIONNAIRES
page.content: In the early 1980s, questionnaires were published,displays erected and meetings held for all inhabitants of the areas affected by the proposed Pudsey/Dishforth motorways east and west of Leeds.The response was very variable,depending on how much each individual would be affected. In Harewood,out of a population of 2110, only 20 people gave any response to either route. The 3000 people who responded included landowners objecting to the loss of their land; the general public who were concerned about noise,vibration and pollution factors,and conservationists who feared for the obstruction of scenic views,the effect of "slip-way"areas and the loss of recreational facilities of woodland and riverside walks.
